intro: Lamproconus undulatus, commonly known as the wavy leaf fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaf margins. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to tropical regions of Asia. The plant has pinnately divided fronds with a soft, velvety texture on the underside. Its reproductive structures include sori that are arranged in lines along the underside of the fronds. Lamproconus undulatus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
